Class Heater

java.lang.Object
  Heater

public class Heater
extends java.lang.Object

A Heater models a simple space-heater. The operations provided by a Heater object are: 1. Increase and decrease the temperature setting by a set amount. (Exercise 1) The heater's temperature cannot be raised above a specified maximum value or lowered below a specified minimum value. (Exercise 2) 2. Return the current temperature setting. (Exercise 1) 3. Change the set amount by which the temperature is increased and lowered to a specified non-negative value. (Exercise 2)

Version:
1.01 January 13, 2007, 1.02 March 23, 2011, 1.03 January 11, 2012
Author:
D.L. Bailey, SCE, Carleton University

Constructor Summary
Heater(int minTemp, int maxTemp)
          Constructs a new Heater with an initial temperature setting of 15 degrees, and which increments and decrements the temperature setting in increments of 5 degrees (see methods warmer and cooler).
 
Method Summary
 void cooler()
          Lowers the heater's temperature setting by 5.
 int getTemperature()
          Returns this heater's current temperature setting.
 void setIncrement(int newIncrement)
          Sets the temperature increment used by warmer() and cooler() to the specified value.
 void warmer()
          Increases the heater's temperature setting by 5.
